events.name: Junior Maker Program: Bonding through Making
events.description: Join us this June Holidays as we introduce a series of maker workshops suitable for families and childrens! All workshops are curated by OneMaker Group - OMG, supported by DesignSingapore and National Design Centre to cultivate home grown makers to develop their passion and help grow the Maker Movement in Singapore.
events.location: National Design Centre, 111 Middle Road, Singapore 188969

events.name: HHSG BUILD
events.description: CURRENT PROJECT Where are you on Singapore’s meritocracy scale? Chat with our bot to find out where you stand on the meritocracy vs privilege scale and see how you compare with your peers. >>START HERE<< WHAT WE ARE WORKING ON THIS WEEK Need help to convert secondary schools JSON data into usable CSVs Sort secondary school rankings into a CSV so we can create PSLE cut-off points Finalise the final data for input into the calculator and transform into JSON file if need be Start on skeleton of the project if possible - need coders Designers welcome to start mocking up, creating styles PROJECT BACKGROUND Singapore prides itself on being a meritocratic society where one can get ahead in life based on their efforts, not their inherited privilege. Yet, the process to get into the first stage of education, primary schools, is through a system of phases which can depend entirely on your parents’ connections and background. This may or may not have a domino-like effect on the chances for the student as they progress through their education as certain schools are better equipped and have better connections - all the way through to university and beyond. The aim is to get the conversation started for Singaporeans today by challenging their preconceived opinions of their own progress through life. In essence, it will be a 'privilege calculator' where you can measure where you stand on the scale: Meritocracy or Parentocracy. More specifically, it can help the reader to calculate - via proxy indicators - to what extent they have made use of socio-economic privileges passed down from your parents or family or connections versus to what extent you have either: Not used this privileges and instead got to where you were on your own ORNot had access to these privileges UPDATES VIA SLACK: https://hhsg-slack.herokuapp.com/ TRELLO BOARD: https://trello.com/invite/b/wDIl5vep/6347f978659531692bee1cb22db12396/hhsg-build GITHUB: https://github.com/HHSG/privilegecalculator GOOGLE DRIVE: https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/0BxBGozlxM_ZEUzRxajVoZ0dSQkU?usp=sharing  WHAT IS HHSG BUILD? It is Hacks/Hackers Singapore's (HHSG) weekly hands on session for those who are willing to spare a few precious weekend hours to create a data-driven or interactive journalism project. We are willing to work on anything but since it will be on a voluntary basis, the ideas must be of social or learning value. The final project may or may not be published but everything we work on will adhere to open source and open data principals.
events.location: ST Innovation Lab - SPH, 1000 Toa Payoh North, Singapore

events.name: Cosmology in Maths and Art
events.description:
Get inspired by geometrical designs from some of the most famous and beautiful Islamic architecture and art including the Great Mosque of Cordoba, Spain, the Qarawiyyin Mosque of Morroco, the Huand Hatun Complex of Turkey and more to kickstart your journey to master this ancient medieval art. Create your own intricate patterns or recreate classic examples.

Best for youth and adult learners. Children aged 10 and above are welcomed.

Class will only commence with 10 sign ups.
events.location: OneMaker Group - OMG, 111 Middle Road, #01-02, National Design Centre, Singapore 188969

events.name: Tech Saturday Season 3 Week 9
events.description: This is it. WE. ARE. PLANTING!!!
events.location: Community Lab at United World College SEA, 1 Tampines Street 73, #01-D119, Singapore 528704
